name: Hotelkeeper's responsibility in case of fire, etc.
text: The keeper of any hotel shall only be liable to any guest of the hotel, for ordinary and reasonable care in the custody of money, jewels, bank notes, precious stones, transportation tickets, negotiable or valuable papers, ornaments, baggage, wearing apparel, or other chattels or property belonging to any guest, whether specially intrusted to the keeper or the keeper's agent, or deposited in the safe of the hotel, for any loss occasioned by fire or by any other cause or force, over which the proprietor had no control. [L 1978, c 234, pt of §3; gen ch 1985]
